case_vignette: A 11-year-old male with past medical history of medulloblastoma is brought to dermatology clinic for evaluation of multiple "moles" on the face, neck, arms and legs! Patient's mother reports developing similar lesions when she was younger and a history of ovarian fibromas!  Examination reveals multiple thin brown pedunculated papules on the cheeks, neck, and upper chest and back! Focal atrophic ovoid papules are appreciated on the palms bilaterally!
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have multiple small brown raised spots on my cheeks, neck, upper chest, and back, and some flat, slightly indented spots on my palms.
Do these spots itch, bleed, or cause pain?
No, they do not itch, bleed, or cause pain.
Have you noticed any changes in the appearance of these spots over time?
No, I haven't noticed any changes in the appearance of these spots over time.
Do you have any known allergies or a history of skin conditions in your family?
Yes, my mother developed similar skin lesions when she was younger.
Do you currently take any medications or have you started any new drugs recently?
No, I have not started any new medications recently.
Final Diagnosis: Darier Disease

Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have multiple thin brown raised spots on my cheeks, neck, upper chest, and back, and also some flat, slightly indented spots on both of my palms.
How long have you noticed these symptoms?
My mother mentioned that these spots have been developing since I was younger.
Do these spots itch or cause any discomfort?
No, they do not itch or cause any discomfort.

I have a medical condition called medulloblastoma.
Do you have any family history of similar skin conditions or genetic disorders?
Yes, my mother developed similar skin lesions when she was younger and she also has a history of ovarian fibromas.
Final Diagnosis: Gorlin Syndrome (Basal Cell Nevus Syndrome)
